titles.title: Investment Adviser Oversight Act of 2012
Investment Adviser Oversight Act of 2012
To amend the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 to provide for the registration and oversight of national investment adviser associations.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

bill.summary:
Investment Adviser Oversight Act of 2012 - Amends the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 to require investment advisers to register with a registered national investment adviser association, unless exempted according to specified criteria.
Prescribes registration requirements and procedures.
Requires each national investment adviser association to conduct an annual conference to which representatives from the state securities administrators association and the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) shall be invited to participate in order to foster cooperation between such entities.
Sets forth procedures for: (1) approval of registration; and (2) discipline of members by a national investment adviser association, including membership denial and summary suspension.
Grants the SEC enforcement authority including suspension and expulsion of members and removal or censure of officers and directors.
